Summary: Directly above my head I observed a brilliant blue/white circular light hovering at high altitude.
divs: sighting detailsi, my daughter and friend pulling into my driveway, stepped out of my vehicle and walked toward the front door. as i walked around the vehicle front to the passenger door i observed through a clearing in the trees across the street a very "blue" meteorite falling at a 45 degree angle in the north east horizon on the west range of the sandia mountains. the meteorite left a fairly long trail of blue smaller pieces. i was impressed with the vibrant blue color. i immediately marked my location according to surrounding trees in my view. excitedly i ran into my home to tell my friend and daughter what i had just seen and they followed me back out the front door within 5 seconds. we ran to the middle of the unoccupied street (still daylight\dusk coming on in 10 minutes or so.) we watched the same area for 10 brief seconds. still in the street, my friend said at the same i looked up, "what's that light?" looking directly above our heads was a very obvious stationary circular shaped blue\white extremely bright light. the altitude of the "light" was unknown. however, looking at approximately the altitude an airplane jet might fly, and below the scattered clouds. observing the unmoving light for about 8-10 seconds the light keeping its circular shape began to shrink, it appeared to dim before our eyes. the light continued to shrink dimming to "off." at this point my friend no longer to see the greyish dot, ran back into the house to get the camera and binoculars. i stayed outside in the street keeping my vision locked onto the "dimming" light which then appeared as a tiny pinhead size greyish colored "dot" craft barely visible. the grey dot then proceeded to slowly float a thumbs length north east, pause briefly and slowly float another thumb length still in the north east direction. the grey dot disappeared very high into the few high clouds until i lost sight of it. whether the craft actually increased its altitude or actually dimmed its lights from brilliant to dim is incredible. this was my first sighting and i was amazed and thrilled with the experience. watching the light dim, fade, go off, was absolutely incredible. following the path of the pinhead dot as it floated until it was out of sight was a little freaky. very cool...
